Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

using the following format:

The variable i is not used in the proof. But if I take it away, then theorem in line 1433 breaks.
The proof there should be fixed by something like `haveI : IsLocalization (M.map (algebraMap R S)) Sâ‚˜ := i` instead.
Or maybe we should make `Algebra.algebraMapSubmonoid` reducible.
I changed the proof in line 1433 so that now it works.

```suggestion
@[to_additive "Given an injective `AddCommMonoid` homomorphism `g : M â†’+ P`, and a
```

```suggestion
    (k : LocalizationMap (Submonoid.map g S) Q) :
    Injective (map f (apply_coe_mem_map g S) k : N â†’* Q) := by
```

```suggestion
end IsLocalization

```

```suggestion
    [IsCancelMulZero M] (h : âˆ€ â¦ƒxâ¦„, x âˆˆ S â†’ IsRegular x) : IsCancelMulZero N := by
```

```suggestion
  have : IsLeftCancelMulZero N :=
```

```suggestion
```

a bit of routine golfs, spacing fixes, parentheses removals:
```suggestion
    (k : LocalizationMap (S.map g) Q) :
    Injective (map f (apply_coe_mem_map g S) k) := fun z w hizw â†¦ by
  set i := map f (apply_coe_mem_map g S) k
  have ifkg (a : M) : i (f.toMap a) = k.toMap (g a) := map_eq f (apply_coe_mem_map g S) a
  obtain âŸ¨x, hxâŸ© := surj f z
  obtain âŸ¨y, hyâŸ© := surj f w
  rw [(eq_mk'_iff_mul_eq f).mpr hx, (eq_mk'_iff_mul_eq f).mpr hy, LocalizationMap.eq]
  --- The following is equivalent to `hizw : i z = i w`
  obtain âŸ¨d, hdâŸ© : âˆƒ d : S.map g, d * (g y.2 * g x.1) = d * (g x.2 * g y.1) := by
    lift g x.2 to S.map g using apply_coe_mem_map g S x.2 with gx2 hgx2
    lift g y.2 to S.map g using apply_coe_mem_map g S y.2 with gy2 hgy2
    have eqz := congrArg i hx
    rw [map_mul, ifkg, ifkg, â† hgx2] at eqz
    have eqw := congrArg i hy
    rw [map_mul, ifkg, ifkg, â† hgy2] at eqw
    rw [(eq_mk'_iff_mul_eq k).mpr eqz, (eq_mk'_iff_mul_eq k).mpr eqw, LocalizationMap.eq] at hizw
    exact hizw
  obtain âŸ¨c, hcâŸ© := (Set.exists_image_iff g S _).mp (exists_apply_eq_apply' Subtype.val d)
  simp_rw [hc, â† map_mul] at hd
  --- The last step is just applying hg, injectivity of g
  exact âŸ¨c, hg hdâŸ©
```

I think when working with semirings (where you can't subtract and compare with zero) it's convenient to introduce a `surjâ‚‚` lemma that gives you a common denominator for both z and w. The same for `IsLocalization` and `IsLocalizedModule`. Would you like to do that?

Do you mean something like 
```
theorem surjâ‚‚ (f : LocalizationMap S N) (z w : N) : âˆƒ x : M Ã— M Ã— S, 
    (z * f.toMap x.2.2 = f.toMap x.1) âˆ§  (w * f.toMap x.2.2 = f.toMap x.2.1) := by 
```
Yes! Though I'm not a big fan of using existential over a product, and I think `âˆƒ z' w' : M, âˆƒ x : S, â€¦` is probably easier to use.
I added that lemma, but I am not happy with the long proof.

If you're not planning to add more stuff to this section, you may remove the section and move the `variable` into the theorem statement.
```suggestion
theorem map_injective_of_injective (hg : Function.Injective g) [IsLocalization (M.map g) Q] :
    Function.Injective (map Q g (Submonoid.le_comap_map M) : S â†’ Q) :=
  (toLocalizationMap M S).map_injective_of_injective hg (toLocalizationMap (M.map g) Q)
```

better as
```suggestion
  have : IsLocalization (M.map (algebraMap R S)) Sâ‚˜ := i
  IsLocalization.map_injective_of_injective _ _ _ hRS
```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion simp_rw [hc,â† map_mul] at hd ```
I am not sure if the name of the lemma is OK, or it will be better another one.  It is related to the `surjâ‚‚` theorem above.

```suggestion
    (z * algebraMap R S d = algebraMap R S z') âˆ§ (w * algebraMap R S d = algebraMap R S w') :=
```
you may leave out the parentheses as well.

```suggestion
    Function.Injective (map Q g M.le_comap_map : S â†’ Q) :=
```

Again some routine golfs, plus docstring edits (I use `/` rather than `* â»Â¹` for uniformity with the additive docstring.
```suggestion
/-- Given a localization map `f : M â†’* N`, and `z w : N`, there exist `z' w' : M` and `d : S`
such that `f z' / f d = z` and `f w' / f d = w`. -/
@[to_additive
    "Given a localization map `f : M â†’+ N`, and `z w : N`, there exist `z' w' : M` and `d : S`
such that `f z' - f d = z` and `f w' - f d = w`."]
theorem surjâ‚‚ (f : LocalizationMap S N) (z w : N) : âˆƒ z' w' : M, âˆƒ d : S,
    (z * f.toMap d = f.toMap z') âˆ§  (w * f.toMap d = f.toMap w') := by
  let âŸ¨a, haâŸ© := surj f z
  let âŸ¨b, hbâŸ© := surj f w
  refine âŸ¨a.1 * b.2 , a.2 * b.1 , a.2 * b.2, ?_, ?_âŸ©
  Â· simp_rw [mul_def, map_mul, â† ha]
    exact (mul_assoc z _ _).symm
  Â· simp_rw [mul_def, map_mul, â† hb]
    exact mul_left_comm w _ _
```
I now think it's probably better to call it `mk'_eq_of_same` ...

We don't usually capitalize declaration names like this (and Localization isn't a declaration name per se). Docstrings are meant to be natural/mathematical language descriptions, and declaration names should only be used if that level of specificity is necessary to explain certain details.)
Here, it's okay to call an AddMonoid a monoid in mathematical language, just like we call $\mathbb{Z}$ a group. (If you want to be specific, it would be "additive monoid".)
```suggestion
/-- Given an injective `CommMonoid` homomorphism `g : M â†’* P`, and a submonoid `S âŠ† M`,
the induced monoid homomorphism from the localization of `M` at `S` to the
localization of `P` at `g S`, is injective.
-/
@[to_additive "Given an injective `AddCommMonoid` homomorphism `g : M â†’+ P`, and a
submonoid `S âŠ† M`, the induced monoid homomorphism from the localization of `M` at `S`
to the localization of `P` at `g S`, is injective. "]
```

The docstring disappeared when you generalized and moved this ...
```suggestion
/-- Injectivity of a map descends to the map induced on localizations. -/
theorem map_injective_of_injective (h : Function.Injective g) [IsLocalization (M.map g) Q] :
```

a more compact proof without using `eq_of_same`:
```suggestion
theorem map_injective_of_injective (hg : Injective g) (k : LocalizationMap (S.map g) Q) :
    Injective (map f (apply_coe_mem_map g S) k) := fun z w hizw â†¦ by
  set i := map f (apply_coe_mem_map g S) k
  have ifkg (a : M) : i (f.toMap a) = k.toMap (g a) := map_eq f (apply_coe_mem_map g S) a
  let âŸ¨z', w', x, hxz, hxwâŸ© := surjâ‚‚ f z w
  have : k.toMap (g z') = k.toMap (g w')
  Â· rw [â† ifkg, â† ifkg, â† hxz, â† hxw, map_mul, map_mul, hizw]
  obtain âŸ¨âŸ¨_, c, hc, rflâŸ©, eqâŸ© := k.exists_of_eq _ _ this
  simp_rw [â† map_mul, hg.eq_iff] at eq
  rw [â† (f.map_units x).mul_left_inj, hxz, hxw, f.eq_iff_exists]
  exact âŸ¨âŸ¨c, hcâŸ©, eqâŸ©
```

```suggestion
  refine âŸ¨a.1 * b.2, a.2 * b.1, a.2 * b.2, ?_, ?_âŸ©
```
